item.title: Health Care Questions Enter Virginia Governor's Race
item.description: July 2, 2017 - Virginia Republican gubernatorial nominee Ed Gillespie is getting questions about health care on the campaign trail. His Democratic rival, Ralph Northam, is also making it a campaign issue.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 2, 2017 - Virginia Republican gubernatorial nominee Ed Gillespie is getting questions about health care on the campaign trail. His Democratic rival, Ralph Northam, is also making it a campaign issue. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/02/535240741/health-care-questions-enter-virginia-governor-s-race

item.title: In Fighting Abuse By Members Of Catholic Church Clergy, Victim Sees Resistance To Change
item.description: July 2, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro discusses the Catholic Church's response to its sexual abuse scandal with Marie Collins, who recently resigned from the Pontifical Commission for the Protection of Minors.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 2, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro discusses the Catholic Church's response to its sexual abuse scandal with Marie Collins, who recently resigned from the Pontifical Commission for the Protection of Minors. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/02/535240699/in-fighting-abuse-by-members-of-catholic-church-clergy-victim-sees-resistance-to

item.title: The Call-In: Your Questions About The Senate Health Care Bill
item.description: July 2, 2017 - In this week's Call-In, NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with health reporters about the impact the current Senate health care bill will have — and answer callers' specific questions.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 2, 2017 - In this week's Call-In, NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with health reporters about the impact the current Senate health care bill will have — and answer callers' specific questions. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/02/535240692/the-call-in-your-questions-about-the-senate-health-care-bill

item.title: 'One Of A Kind' Collection Of Animal Eyeballs Aids Research On Vision Problems
item.description: July 2, 2017 - Most of the 56,000 eyes sent to the little lab in Wisconsin come from vets who want help diagnosing dogs, cats and horses. But the repository also has eyes from sloths, elephant seals and dragonflies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 2, 2017 - Most of the 56,000 eyes sent to the little lab in Wisconsin come from vets who want help diagnosing dogs, cats and horses. But the repository also has eyes from sloths, elephant seals and dragonflies. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/02/534950252/one-of-a-kind-collection-of-animal-eyeballs-aids-research-on-vision-problems

item.title: Hoop Dreams: Wheelchair Basketball Is Changing Lives In Afghanistan
item.description: July 2, 2017 - The head of the Red Cross orthopedic program wasn't sure a basketball team was a good idea. The players proved him wrong.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 2, 2017 - The head of the Red Cross orthopedic program wasn't sure a basketball team was a good idea. The players proved him wrong. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/02/528498720/hoop-dreams-wheelchair-basketball-is-changing-lives-in-afghanistan

item.title: What You Should Know About The Senate Health Care Bill
item.description:
July 1, 2017 - Kaiser Health News Chief Washington Correspondent Julie Rovner gives the latest news on the Senate health care bill.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/07/01/535187220/what-you-should-know-about-the-senate-health-care-bill
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: A Hospital In Rural Colorado Is The Cornerstone Of Small Town Life
item.description: July 1, 2017 - At the lone hospital in Hugo, a country town, staff members know most of the patients — they are friends and family. But cuts in the GOP health bill could threaten this cherished institution.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 1, 2017 - At the lone hospital in Hugo, a country town, staff members know most of the patients — they are friends and family. But cuts in the GOP health bill could threaten this cherished institution. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/01/534555070/a-hospital-in-rural-colorado-is-the-cornerstone-of-small-town-life

item.title: NPR Continues To Find Hundreds Of Cases Of Advanced Black Lung
item.description: July 1, 2017 - Black lung results from exposure to coal dust. Progressive massive fibrosis is an especially aggressive form, blamed on inhalation of silica dust from the cutting of quartz rock and coal together.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 1, 2017 - Black lung results from exposure to coal dust. Progressive massive fibrosis is an especially aggressive form, blamed on inhalation of silica dust from the cutting of quartz rock and coal together. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/01/535082619/npr-continues-to-find-hundreds-of-cases-of-advanced-black-lung

item.title: To Solve Gruesome Desert Mysteries, Scientists Become Body Collectors
item.description: July 1, 2017 - People are dumping corpses in the high desert of western Colorado. But those unloading bodies aren't criminal masterminds. They're scientists. And out here, the usual rules of human decay don't apply.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 1, 2017 - People are dumping corpses in the high desert of western Colorado. But those unloading bodies aren't criminal masterminds. They're scientists. And out here, the usual rules of human decay don't apply. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/01/523024955/to-solve-gruesome-desert-mysteries-scientists-become-body-collectors

item.title: 'Healing Children': A Surgeon's Take On What Kids Need
item.description: July 1, 2017 - Dr. Kurt Newman has spent his career caring for children. In a new book, he argues that children are not just smaller adults, and the differences matter for their treatment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 1, 2017 - Dr. Kurt Newman has spent his career caring for children. In a new book, he argues that children are not just smaller adults, and the differences matter for their treatment. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/01/534884325/healing-children-a-surgeons-take-on-what-kids-need

item.title: GOP Health Bill Could Let Insurers Cap Spending On Expensive Patients
item.description: June 30, 2017 - Current law requires all health insurance sold on the exchanges to cover 10 essential benefits — with no annual or lifetime limits to reimbursement. But the GOP plan might let states reinstate limits.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 30, 2017 - Current law requires all health insurance sold on the exchanges to cover 10 essential benefits — with no annual or lifetime limits to reimbursement. But the GOP plan might let states reinstate limits. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/30/534773322/gop-health-bill-could-let-insurers-cap-spending-on-expensive-patients

item.title: Government Researchers Plan Response To Rising Rates Of Black Lung Disease
item.description: June 30, 2017 - Government researchers met in West Virginia this week in response to an NPR investigation and federal study showing much higher rates of the most serious stages of the coal miners' disease black lung.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 30, 2017 - Government researchers met in West Virginia this week in response to an NPR investigation and federal study showing much higher rates of the most serious stages of the coal miners' disease black lung. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/30/535059200/government-researchers-plan-response-to-rising-rates-of-black-lung-disease

item.title: GOP Lawmakers Face Political Risks In Supporting Unpopular Health Care Bill
item.description: June 30, 2017 - Congressional Republicans say the political risks of failing to make good on their promise to dismantle the Affordable Care Act outweigh the risks of passing an unpopular bill.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 30, 2017 - Congressional Republicans say the political risks of failing to make good on their promise to dismantle the Affordable Care Act outweigh the risks of passing an unpopular bill. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/30/535059169/gop-lawmakers-face-political-risks-in-supporting-unpopular-health-care-bill

item.title: For Newborns Exposed To Opioids, Health Issues May Be The Least Of Their Problems
item.description: June 30, 2017 - Dr. Joshua Sharfstein says worry less about the short-term withdrawal symptoms of babies exposed to opioids in the womb, and much more about the lives and mothers they go home to.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 30, 2017 - Dr. Joshua Sharfstein says worry less about the short-term withdrawal symptoms of babies exposed to opioids in the womb, and much more about the lives and mothers they go home to. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/30/534911289/for-newborns-exposed-to-opioids-health-issues-may-be-the-least-of-their-problems

item.title: How To Stop The World's Worst Cholera Outbreak
item.description: June 30, 2017 - There are more than 200,000 cases in Yemen, a war-ravaged country whose health system is collapsing. We asked specialists what needs to happen to bring the disease under control.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 30, 2017 - There are more than 200,000 cases in Yemen, a war-ravaged country whose health system is collapsing. We asked specialists what needs to happen to bring the disease under control. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/30/534873405/how-to-stop-the-worlds-worst-cholera-outbreak
